main event: Two civilian men sighted an unidentified metallic-looking object that appeared round at one angle and flat at another, maneuvering at an altitude of around 15,000 feet in Ramer, Alabama on February 16, 1953.
interesting points: The object was observed for about 20 minutes, performing maneuvers such as climbing, diving, and making sharp, abrupt left and right turns in and around a formation of clouds.
The observers were described as relatively inexperienced, and it was suggested they may have sighted a fighter aircraft, possibly an F-86, maneuvering below the clouds at 20,000 feet.
The object was reported to be moving at a high speed, estimated around 500-600 mph.
No other known aircraft were reported in the area at the time, besides an F-86 interceptor that was observed separately.
The object was described as having a metallic, pendulum-shaped appearance with delta or swept-back wings.
result: possibly an aircraft, such as an F-86 fighter
sighted object: a metallic-looking, pendulum-shaped object with delta or swept-back wings
